intro: Hieracium nannocephalum, commonly known as the small-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, while its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Hieracium nannocephalum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
